description: High debt-to-equity ratio of 2.8x due to infrastructure financing. Ratio exceeds industry benchmark of 1.5x.
mitigationPlan: Negotiate debt restructuring with lenders; explore equity injection from GRZ; prioritise revenue-generating capex over non-critical capital expenditure

description: Aging generation and transmission infrastructure causes frequent unplanned outages and load shedding, resulting in lost revenue and economic damage to customers. Average asset age exceeds 35 years.
mitigationPlan: Implement capital maintenance programme targeting highest-risk assets; accelerate transmission upgrade capex; establish equipment spare parts strategic reserve

description: ZESCO tariff levels remain significantly below cost-reflective levels, creating a structural revenue deficit of approximately ZMW 780,000,000 per annum. Continued below-cost-recovery tariffs threaten long-term financial viability.
mitigationPlan: Progress ERB tariff review application; engage Ministry of Energy for policy support; implement cost reduction measures to partially close gap pending tariff approval

description: Prolonged drought conditions linked to El Nino climate cycle have reduced Kariba Dam water levels to critically low levels, threatening capacity of the 1,080 MW Kafue Gorge and 600 MW Kariba North hydropower stations which provide over 85% of national generation capacity.
mitigationPlan: Accelerate solar IPP procurement to diversify generation mix; negotiate emergency power imports from Mozambique (HCB) and Eskom; implement structured load management programme

description: ZESCO SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) systems and Operational Technology (OT) networks present significant cybersecurity vulnerabilities, including outdated firmware, insufficient network segmentation between IT and OT environments, and absence of 24/7 Security Operations Centre monitoring.
mitigationPlan: Implement OT/IT network segmentation; upgrade SCADA firmware; establish 24/7 SOC with ICS/SCADA-specialist capability; conduct annual penetration testing on critical systems

description: Over 85% of ZESCO generation capacity is hydro-based, creating extreme vulnerability to Southern African climate variability. Continued over-reliance on hydropower is incompatible with Zambia's NDC commitments and energy security objectives as drought frequency increases.
mitigationPlan: Implement Renewable Energy Integration Roadmap per MoE-DIR-2023-008; fast-track solar and wind IPP agreements; target 30% non-hydro mix by 2028; progress Kafue Gorge Lower extension

description: Partial non-compliance with 3 of 45 ERB licence conditions, primarily relating to environmental impact monitoring reporting timelines and customer complaint resolution turnaround standards. Risk is low following implementation of remediation plan.
mitigationPlan: All remediation actions completed. Environmental reporting system automated. Customer complaint tracking dashboard deployed. ERB satisfied with compliance as at April 2024 review.

description: Aggregate non-performing loan (NPL) ratio across IDC direct lending portfolio stands at 18.5%, significantly above the 10% internal threshold. Five portfolio companies with combined exposure of ZMW 420,000,000 are in technical default or material covenant breach.
mitigationPlan: Engage distressed portfolio companies with restructuring plans; increase loan loss provisioning to 25% of NPL exposure; consider debt-equity swaps for strategically important but financially distressed entities

description: Declining equity valuations of listed portfolio holdings (including ZANACO and Zambia Sugar) driven by ZMW depreciation and emerging market risk-off sentiment have reduced IDC portfolio NAV by ZMW 340,000,000 in FY2024.
mitigationPlan: Rebalance portfolio towards defensive sectors; review concentration in listed equities relative to total portfolio; assess hedging options for USD-denominated holdings

description: Committed investment pipeline of ZMW 340,000,000 for FY2025 faces a funding gap of ZMW 120,000,000 following delayed GRZ equity injection and lower-than-expected dividend receipts from portfolio companies. Risk of defaulting on agreed investment commitments.
mitigationPlan: Engage Ministry of Finance on accelerated GRZ equity disbursement; explore short-term credit facility with DBZ; prioritise investment commitments by strategic importance; defer non-critical investments

description: Governance weaknesses identified in three subsidiary companies including inadequate board oversight, non-compliance with related-party transaction policies, and delays in financial reporting. Risk of reputational damage and regulatory sanction if not addressed.
mitigationPlan: Deploy IDC governance specialists to remediate subsidiaries; require quarterly board effectiveness self-assessments; enforce IDC Subsidiary Governance Framework; consider board reconstitution where governance failures persist

description: Delays in implementing the SOE privatisation programme per MoF-DIR-2024-005, driven by political economy constraints and lack of strategic investors, are reducing IDC portfolio returns and increasing GRZ fiscal burden. Five planned divestitures are behind schedule by 12-18 months.
mitigationPlan: Re-engage Ministry of Finance and Cabinet on privatisation timeline; develop alternative structures (management contracts, strategic partnerships) where full divestiture is not politically feasible; improve SOE performance to attract investors

description: Sustained negative media coverage of underperforming IDC portfolio companies in 2023, particularly in the mining and manufacturing sectors, damaged IDC brand and complicated investor relations activities. Risk has since diminished following improved portfolio performance reporting.
mitigationPlan: Proactive media engagement strategy implemented. Annual IDC Impact Report launched Q1 2024. Stakeholder communications improved with quarterly investor briefings. Risk rating reduced following positive coverage.

description: Risk of non-compliance with SECZAM disclosure and ESG reporting obligations for FY2024, the first year of mandatory ESG reporting under SEC-DIR-2024-007. Penalty for non-compliance includes suspension of securities market participation for portfolio subsidiaries.
mitigationPlan: ESG framework development workflow in progress (Workflow ID 12). GRI-aligned report on track for April 2025 submission. External assurance provider engaged. Company Secretary monitoring deadline compliance.

description: ZANACO non-performing loan (NPL) ratio rose to 11.2% in Q3 2024, exceeding the BoZ regulatory threshold of 10%. Increased NPLs concentrated in SME lending and agriculture portfolio segments affected by drought and ZMW depreciation. Loan loss provisions of ZMW 680,000,000 recognised in FY2024.
mitigationPlan: Strengthen credit underwriting standards; intensify collection efforts on delinquent accounts; increase IFRS 9 Stage 2 provisioning; submit NPL reduction plan to BoZ; implement early warning system for emerging NPLs

description: ZANACO top 10 depositors account for 35% of total customer deposits (ZMW 6,370,000,000), creating significant concentration risk. Withdrawal of one or more large depositors could trigger liquidity stress requiring emergency BoZ repo facilities.
mitigationPlan: Implement deposit diversification strategy targeting retail and SME segments; expand branch network in underserved provinces; increase HQLA buffer to 25% of total deposits; develop contingency funding plan

description: ZANACO loan book of ZMW 10,400,000,000 has 62% floating-rate exposure linked to the BoZ Policy Rate. Sudden increases in the policy rate (as occurred in 2022-2023) compress net interest margins and increase borrower default probability.
mitigationPlan: Rebalance asset-liability duration mismatch; increase proportion of fixed-rate lending; develop interest rate hedging policy; conduct quarterly interest rate sensitivity analysis and stress tests

description: Legacy core banking system components present cybersecurity vulnerabilities including outdated encryption protocols and insufficient multi-factor authentication for privileged user access. Three attempted unauthorised access incidents recorded in FY2024, though none resulted in a breach.
mitigationPlan: Accelerate Temenos T24 core banking migration (Contract ID 18); implement MFA for all privileged access; engage specialist cybersecurity firm for penetration testing; implement BoZ Cybersecurity Framework per BoZ-DIR-2025-002

description: Risk that rising NPL ratio and increased loan loss provisions compress capital adequacy ratio below the BoZ minimum of 10%. CAR currently at 14.3% but could approach minimum under a severe stress scenario involving simultaneous ZMW depreciation and credit default cycle.
mitigationPlan: Maintain CAR above 12% buffer at all times; conduct quarterly stress tests per BoZ-DIR-2024-003; retain minimum 40% of after-tax profits as capital buffer; explore Tier 2 capital instruments if required

description: BoZ examination in Q2 2023 identified gaps in ZANACO AML/CFT programme including below-standard suspicious transaction report quality and insufficient enhanced due diligence for PEP customers. Risk resolved following comprehensive programme enhancement.
mitigationPlan: Enhancement programme fully implemented per BoZ-DIR-2023-019. Transaction monitoring system upgraded. PEP screening integrated. STR turnaround reduced to 1.5 days. BoZ re-examination passed March 2024.

description: Rapid growth of mobile money operators (MTN Mobile Money, Airtel Money) and fintech lenders is eroding ZANACO market share in payments, remittances, and SME lending. Mobile money transaction volumes now exceed ZANACO retail transaction volumes. Risk of structural revenue decline if digital transformation is not accelerated.
mitigationPlan: Accelerate digital banking expansion per BoZ-DIR-2024-011; complete Temenos T24 migration by Q1 2026; launch ZANACO mobile-first product suite; develop fintech partnership and API banking strategy; target 50% increase in digital customers by 2025

description: Mainline track condition on the Livingstone-Kitwe corridor is severely deteriorated with approximately 340 km (32%) of track classified as Category 3 or 4 (requiring speed restrictions of 20-40 km/h or complete suspension). Deteriorating track is the primary driver of service unreliability, train delays, and derailment risk.
mitigationPlan: Implement 3-year track rehabilitation plan per MoT-DIR-2024-004 with minimum ZMW 1,200,000,000 capital investment; accelerate Phase 1 (Livingstone-Mazabuka) rehabilitation; apply emergency tamping and surfacing to highest-risk sections

description: Railway safety incident rate stands at 4.2 incidents per million train kilometres, compared to the RTSA target of 2.0. Twelve Category A safety deficiencies remain partially unresolved from the 2023 RTSA safety audit, including deficiencies in track geometry, signal equipment, and level crossing safety.
mitigationPlan: Progress rectification of all Category A RTSA safety deficiencies within agreed timelines; implement SMS per RTSA framework; enhance safety leadership training; install speed monitoring systems on high-risk sections; increase track inspection frequency

description: FY2024 revenue of ZMW 420,000,000 represents a shortfall of 31% against the ZMW 610,000,000 budget, driven by poor service reliability deterring freight customers who divert to road haulage. Operating costs are largely fixed, resulting in an operating deficit of ZMW 260,000,000 requiring GRZ subsidy.
mitigationPlan: Implement service reliability recovery plan per MoT-DIR-2023-011; negotiate long-term freight contracts with Copperbelt mining companies; reduce operating cost through fuel efficiency programme; secure GRZ operating subsidy in FY2025 budget

description: Zambia Railways market share in Lusaka-Copperbelt freight corridor has declined from 38% to 21% over 5 years, as unreliable rail service drives permanent modal shift to road haulage. Without structural improvement in service reliability, further market share loss is inevitable and difficult to reverse.
mitigationPlan: Prioritise service reliability improvements; develop competitive multi-modal freight offering; target copper mining sector with dedicated freight service guarantees; complete track rehabilitation to enable higher average speeds and improved timetable adherence

description: Only 8 of ZR's 28 mainline locomotives are currently serviceable (28% availability), against an operational requirement of 16 locomotives for the current traffic plan. Locomotive unavailability is the binding constraint on freight capacity and a primary driver of train cancellations.
mitigationPlan: Implement GE Zambia locomotive maintenance contract (Contract ID 25) targeting 75% fleet availability; progress fleet renewal procurement per MoT-DIR-2024-009; explore lease of second-hand locomotives from South African or Zimbabwean operators in the interim

description: Risk that ZR operating certificate issued by RTSA could be suspended or restricted if Category A safety deficiencies from the 2023 safety audit are not rectified within agreed timelines. Certificate suspension would halt operations and trigger force majeure on freight contracts.
mitigationPlan: Maintain monthly safety compliance reporting to RTSA; escalate Category A deficiency rectification pace; proactively engage RTSA on progress; consider seeking 60-day extension for remaining 5 unresolved Category A items

description: ZR maintains approximately 850,000 litres of diesel fuel at 14 depot locations across the network, several of which have aging underground storage tanks and inadequate secondary containment. An uncontrolled spill could result in significant environmental damage, regulatory penalty, and reputational harm.
mitigationPlan: Commission audit of all fuel storage facilities; replace or reline aging underground tanks at highest-risk depots (Kabwe, Ndola, Livingstone); install fuel management monitoring systems; develop environmental emergency response plan

description: ZCCM-IH primary income is dividends from copper and cobalt mining portfolio companies. LME copper price volatility directly impacts dividend income and NAV per share. A USD 500/t decline in copper price reduces estimated annual dividend income by approximately ZMW 180,000,000.
mitigationPlan: Maintain diversified portfolio across copper, cobalt, and emerald commodities; implement hedging strategy review annually; monitor LME prices daily; maintain minimum ZMW 600M liquidity reserve

description: Independent actuarial reviews indicate mine rehabilitation closure cost estimates are increasing at 7-10% per annum. A 15% shortfall in the ZMW 3.8 billion rehabilitation fund would require an emergency provision top-up of approximately ZMW 570 million impacting profitability.
mitigationPlan: Conduct annual independent actuarial review; maintain rehabilitation fund at 105% of current cost estimate; engage ZEMA for multi-year funding agreement; commission engineering review of Luanshya and Baluba sites

description: ZCCM-IH has oversight responsibility for 14 tailings storage facilities across portfolio mines. Failure of a tailings dam could cause catastrophic environmental damage, loss of life, mine closure, and reputational damage. Post-Brumadinho international regulatory environment increases scrutiny of tailings facilities.
mitigationPlan: Implement ICOLD and MAC tailings dam safety framework across portfolio mines; require independent Tailings Review Boards; conduct annual aerial surveillance and geotechnical inspection; maintain emergency response plans; report TSF status to Board Audit Committee quarterly

description: Portfolio mine dividend income is denominated in USD while ZCCM-IH reports in ZMW. ZMW/USD depreciation artificially inflates reported ZMW dividend income but reduces real purchasing power. ZCCM-IH listed share price on LuSE and AIM can diverge due to currency movements.
mitigationPlan: Maintain USD-denominated bank accounts for dividend receipts; implement natural hedging; board to approve annual currency risk management policy; report currency impact separately in financial statements

description: Zambia mining royalty structure has changed multiple times since 2015. Changes to the Mines and Minerals Development Act, Income Tax Act, or development agreements governing Kansanshi and Lumwana could significantly reduce portfolio mine profitability and ZCCM-IH dividend income. AIM Rule changes could also alter disclosure obligations.
mitigationPlan: Engage Ministry of Mines, ZRA, and Ministry of Finance proactively; participate in Zambia Chamber of Mines regulatory working groups; monitor AIM Rule and FCA regulatory developments; maintain legal advisory relationships with Corpus Legal Practitioners and Herbert Smith Freehills London

description: Gold price volatility on international markets directly impacts revenue. A 10% decline in the USD gold price reduces annual revenues by approximately ZMW 280,000,000, threatening dividend and capital expenditure plans.
mitigationPlan: Implement partial gold price hedging programme covering up to 30% of annual production; diversify revenue through value-added refinery services; maintain adequate reserves buffer for price downturns

description: Artisanal and small-scale miners (ASMs) may sell gold to unlicensed dealers outside formal channels due to payment delays or below-market pricing, undermining gold procurement volumes and formalisation objectives.
mitigationPlan: Offer competitive buying prices aligned to London Bullion Market Association (LBMA) daily fix; operate 24-hour payment cycles at all buying centres; expand buying centre network to remote mining areas; partner with Bank of Zambia on mobile payment platforms for ASM payments

description: Changes to the Mines and Minerals Development Act, or amendments to the statutory mandate of Zambia Gold Company, could restrict gold buying rights, alter royalty rates, or affect the company's exclusive rights to purchase gold from artisanal miners.
mitigationPlan: Maintain proactive engagement with Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development; participate in legislative review consultations; ensure legal team monitors all proposed Mining Act amendments; review statutory mandate documentation annually
riskOwner: Head of Legal and Regulatory Affairs

description: Zambia Gold Company is relatively nascent (established 2020) with limited retained earnings and relies on short-term trade finance facilities for gold procurement. Any tightening of credit conditions or withdrawal of banking facilities could disrupt procurement operations.
mitigationPlan: Diversify trade finance facilities across multiple banks; maintain revolving credit facilities with at least three commercial banks; build cash reserves equivalent to 2 months of gold procurement; explore Export Development Finance from Trade Development Bank
